name: Coloured Deluxe
overview: Where the original Coloured game offered a 3x3 grid of colors and challenged you to match 3 in a row by hitting the space bar at the right time, this one offers a 4x4 grid, and challenges you to get 4 in a row! This version does support joystick use instead of all keyboard commands, which speeds things up a bit. It is almost as if this was just a game to get you to listen to his new musical composition, as Richard Bayliss also did the music for this game of chance.
